content.en: Energy-efficient algorithms: Researchers have proposed various algorithms to address the challenge of energy efficiency in multi-core systems. These algorithms, such as TL-DVFS, simulated annealing, and Monte Carlo, aim to minimize energy consumption by optimizing task scheduling, task synchronization, and task partitioning. By leveraging techniques like per-core DVFS, voltage islands, and global DVFS, these algorithms balance performance and energy consumption, ultimately leading to more energy-efficient computing systems.
content.da: Energieffektive algoritmer: Forskere har foreslået forskellige algoritmer for at tackle udfordringen med energieffektivitet i multi-core systemer. Disse algoritmer, såsom TL-DVFS, simuleret annealing og Monte Carlo, sigter mod at minimere energiforbrug ved at optimere opgavestyring, opgavesynkronisering og opgavefordeling. Ved at udnytte teknikker som per-core DVFS, voltage islands og global DVFS, balancerer disse algoritmer mellem ydeevne og energiforbrug, hvilket i sidste ende fører til mere energieffektive computersystemer.
